column4: I installed EasyCam2, but when I type "lauchcam2" in a terminal, it doesn't open .. Why?! :(
Have you tried testing the webcam with anything yet?  Like VLC?
The light at the top isn't even on..
I can't say about the light, but if it were me, I would test it just to see.
Fine, but if it only shows up under lsusb, and nothing else anywhere, what do I do with it?
You do not have /dev/video or /dev/video0?
I got /dev/video0
Who knows, maybe the beast will work plug and play - get VLC and open up the camera as a capture device.
Ahh, crazybagua, I got it working, I had VLC looking for /dev/video -_-
Point it to /dev/video0 as the source of course
Excellent.
Next question, how can I make it display a live feed :o
Display it where?
Basically output it to a .ogg file, and stream it live to my other box here
Should be simple, Invisionfree.  But I have not done it.  Have you tried dumping the video capture to a file, and then streaming the file using a stream server?
How
Like, what stream server
But VLC can stream it by itself you know.
1) How, 2) How can I speed it up :x
unless you are hard-wired, your wireless will be your bottleneck
Both me and my server are on wireless
Check out the VLC pages. I don't mean to bail on you, but time for me to give my little one a bath
